runs.comm: good bit of swing for Guruge here and he manages to draw a false shot! The ball takes the outside edge and flies to the third man fielder
good shape again, it moves into the right hander, who manages to nudge it to short fine leg for a quick single
bowls it on a length outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to cover
that is whipped over midwicket for a welcome boundary! He didn't try to hit it too hard, but just flicked the full delivery easily over the infield. That travelled good distance too
back of length this time, the batsman defends it to cover

That is clobbered! This was only marginally short of length but the batsman is so quick on his pull that the ball hardly got a chance to see where it was. It flew flat and quick over midwicket and just lands in front of the rope.. Super shot
tosses it up, the batsman comes forward and defends
he comes out of the crease, but the bowler shortens his length. The ball hits the pads and rolls to the off side
flighted and slow, it's on the pads and the batsman goes for a sweep, but is not able to beat the short fine leg fielder. A misfield allows a  single
this is outside off but the batsman drags it across to deep square leg with a cross batted mow
stays in the crease and punches the length delivery to long on for a single
comes down the pitch, the bowler though slows it down further and the batsman can only push it back to the bowler
he takes a step down the crease and tucks the back of length delivery to backward square leg for a single
the mid-off is up so the batsman goes for a chip over the bowler's head! Not an ideal length as he went full this time

that goes down as a chance! The batsman went for a slog sweep off a slower delivery that went high towards deep square leg. The fielder spotted it late and completely misjudged it, diving over it in the end and allowing it to trickle to the boundary
he looks to cut this one fine, but chops it on to backward point
length delivery, pushed straight to cover
back of length outside off, comes very slow of the surface. The batsman has to wait before he can punch it, but he gets no timing
this is too slow and too short. Wide outside off too. The batsman just waits and thwacks it past the bowler with a muscular baseball hit

even better this time! Swart knew it was going to be fuller and he gets closer to the pitch of the delivery by coming down the track. He makes excellent contact and sends this straight to the sight screen
paddles it fine to short fine leg and calls for a quick single
another short ball, another violent shot! The batsman had all the time to give it good thump over midwicket
he is lucky to get away with a dot as this was down the leg side and short too. The batsman looks to turn it to square leg, but gets a leading edge to the off side
waits on the back foot and punches the length ball down to long on

into the crowd! The bowlers are lacking pace - spinners are slow by 10 kph, seamers, probably by 20 kph. This is short outside off and Myburgh whacks it with ease over midwicket. Way over the boundary boards
slower delivery now and it's not full enough, the batsman tucks it to midwicket

that was a good shout as the batsman plays outside the line of this slower one and gets hit on the knee roll. But it was just cutting too much, going down leg. No, it wasn't. Would have hit the leg stump, hawkeye says. The batsmen take a leg bye
that is a premeditated lap shot! The batsman was ready on his position way before the ball was bowled and does it successfully, ramping it over the short fine leg fielder
more runs! This one is off a false shot as the batsman gets a thick outside edge over the short third man fielder as he tries to punch this length ball to extra cover
shuffles across and dabs the length delivery to the off side for a quick single. Another 16-run over.
he walks down the pitch and flat-bats this gentle medium pacer to mid-on, but the fielder fumbles and the batsman set off for a run. Could have been tricky has the fielder hit the stumps direct
Wow! He has got some willow and that bat swing is a thing of beauty! Only short of length and that is swatted like a fly over the cow corner with ferocity. Way over the ropes again
the batsman punches this fuller delivery in the air towards the right of the bowler , who does well to keep his hand in. It's straight to mid off

oh no! Frustrating for the bowler as he manages to draw a false shot - a top edge - that sails over the keeper's head for a boundary. He was too late on the pull this time and possibly cramped for room
the boot saves the day! He bowls a gentle low full toss that is thumped back down the ground. The bowler managed to stick his boot out to parry it to mid on, otherwise that was four more
slower delivery on a length and without any room, the batsman plays a defensive shot finally
bowls with a slingy action, the batsman dabs the length delivery to midwicket for a single
fuller deliver on off, driven to mid-off for a quick single. Shazad, at 129 kph, looks like the fastest of the bowlers
good delivery! The batsman is hurried by the pace on this one but keeps it out to cover. Thinks of a single, but is rightly sent back in time

one, two, three, and gone! The fielder almost made a complete hash of it! But Shazad has brought some life with a bit of pace. He bowls it short and quick, draws the batsman into a pull, but Swart is a touch late and gets a top edge towards midwicket. The fielder runs in, juggles the ball a few times to give his teammates a bit of a heartache, but manages to hold on
loud appeal for lbw, but that pitched way outside leg stump line. It's the pace again. The batsman looks to push it to mid on, but is too late on the ball
comes forward and punches the length delivery to mid off
full and on off stump, the batsman creams it to long on for a single
full and flighted on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and punches it to long on
fires this on the pads, the batsman misses the flick but gets some boot on it
on the pads, the batsman flicks it straight to short fine leg and takes a quick single
tossed up, it's a low full toss that is whipped to deep midwicket for a single

oh no! This should have been stopped at the wide long on boundary! It was swatted away from outside off and it bounced just before the fielder, but he makes no effort to stop that as it bounces over his head
fires this one full on the leg and middle line, the batsman punches it down to long on
another nippy delivery, this one is short and although it looses pace after bouncing, it does surprise the batsman, who gets out of the way in time
length delivery on the stumps, it's punched to long on

dropped at mid-off! An opportunity goes to waste! The batsman saw the fuller length and looked to drive it over the infield, but it was a slower delivery and he didn't get hold of it. All the fielder had to do is to backpedal early enough. He is late and despite getting a hand to it never looked in control

quick sharp bouncer, completely surprises the batsman. He takes his eyes off the ball as he plays the pull, but that takes an edge, hits the helmet and heads down to the fine leg boundary for four. That's his half-century too
he stays in the crease and clips this fuller delivery to long on for a single
cramps him for room from round the wicket, the batsman tucks it to midwicket for a single
another drop! This time at cover. The batsman punched the full ball in the air and Khurram stretched his left-arm out over his head, but it doesn't stick!
fuller delivery on off, the batsman drives it to long off for a single
fuller and on the stumps, the batsman punches it past the non-striker for a single down to long on
slower delivery on off, the batsman waits and punches it to deep cover for a single

Myburgh could be gone here! The keeper hits the stumps at the striker's end direct. He is gone, by a mile. The batsman looked for a pull, but inside edged it behind the stumps. Myburgh, though, wanted to be on the strike and made a quick dash. But that was straight into the hands of the keeper who makes no mistake in hitting down the stumps in one quick motion. Welcome break for UAE
low full toss on the pads, that is an easy delivery first up and Barresi flicks it to deep square leg for a single
fuller delivery, that is blocked out back to the bowler
that is one crispy crunchy shot! What timing there as he punches this full delivery to the extra cover boundary
two in two! This is wide, full and quick. Cooper stretches out and slides it past short third man for his second boundary
fuller delivery on the stumps, it's punched down to long on
hammered back down the pitch, but the bowler makes a good stop. The umpire had the scare of his life there
full and on off stump line, the batsman drives it to long on for a single
bowls the back-of-the-hand slower ball, but the batsman watches it carefully before punching it to long on
Flat and muscular! That disappears over deep backward square leg. Sumptuous timing from Cooper as he whips this off his hips for maximum return
slower ball down the leg side, the batsman misses the paddle, but the batsman gets a feather on it before the ball reaches the keeper after bouncing once
slower ball on the stumps, the batsman clips it to deep midwicket for a single
length delivery, punched straight to midwicket
he looks to clip it on the leg side, but ends up pushing it back to the bowler as it comes slow of the pitch
waits on the back foot and punches it to long on
he stays in the crease and nudges it to midwicket for a single
good arm ball this! The batsman defends it to midwicket off the back foot
stays in the crease and punches it to long on
pushed through on the stumps, it's punched to long on for another single
length delivery on off, the batsman punches it to long off for a single
length delivery outside off, the batsman waits and cuts it to deep cover for a single
slower length delivery on off, the batsman punches it to deep cover again
slower delivery outside off, the batsman stays in the crease and pushes it to long off
looks to slog it over the cow corner, but gets an thick inside edge on to his body
slower delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to long off
and just when we mentioned fielding, it turns up to be a culprit again! Sitter dropped at long on. The batsman came out of the crease and chipped it straight to him
this one, ooo, this has sailed a long way over the boundary rope. Straight to the sight screen. The batsman gave the charge again but gave it one proper swing this time
Timbah! Barresi is beaten by the lack of pace here. It was short enough to look for a pull to wide long on, but the ball came after the batsman was through with the shot. It stayed low too.
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman goes deep in the crease and works it away to deep midwicket

nicely played reverse paddle! It teases the short third man fielder all the way before he decides to take the matter in his hands. He bends down right in the nick of time to prevent the ball from reaching the boundary
stays in the crease and punches it to deep cover
starts off with a slower delivery, the batsman stands tall and pushes it back to the bowler
looks to punch it through covers, but gets an inside edge that ricochets towards gully after hitting the pads
short ball from Shazad. Borren is in no hurry, he ducks under it well in time
wow! That surprises everyone with the cut and bounce! It beats the shoulder of the bat and bounces over the off stump
goes for a yorker, but this in on the pads and neatly tucked away to deep midwicket
nice flick! That has flown away quickly to the fine leg boundary. It was a full delivery, way down the leg side and Cooper just whips it through with ease
beautiful slower delivery! The batsman goes for an ugly mow and is lucky that this somehow bounces over the off stump.
now a quicker one! This one beats the outside edge too. Borren was looking to push it to cover and he was walking into the shot

another slower ball! another drop! This looks awful. The batsman goes for a slog sweep and gets a big top edge towards short fine leg. The keeper calls early and should have taken it, but he didn't even get close to it. Completely misjudged
he stays on the back foot and defends this to the off side
back of length delivery on off, the batsman pushes it straight to midwicket
bowls that back-of-the-hand slower ball, the batsman punches it to long on for an easy single
looks to hit across the line, but misses it and gets hit on the pads. They take a leg bye

Yes! A catch is taken finally! This time at third man. Borren was getting boring with his cross-batted swipes, so as he sees this bounces, he arches back and stylishly ramps it towards third man, but fails to get any distance. The fielder - Silva it is - holds on to a simple chance.
this one beats the outside edge as the batsman flashes at this length delivery
full delivery on off, the batsman punches it to wide mid on for a single
another short ball, the batsman gets into awkward position, but manages to get his head out of the way
another bouncer, but Ben manages to hook it down to fine leg for a single
bowls it full and on the toes, Ben drives it down to long on
low full toss outside off, the batsman slices it to deep point for a single
this is full and on the blockhole, dug out down the pitch
he punches this one to the leg side, but straight to midwicket
makes some room and carves this to extra cover boundary to end the chase
